column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=And Fanny Brandeis took a long breath
#Text=“ The trouble with the Haynes-Cooper infants ' wear department is that it does n't understand women .
#Text=There are millions of babies born every year .
#Text=An incredible number of them are mail order babies .
#Text=I mean by that they are born to tired , clumsy-fingered immigrant women , to women in mills and factories , to women on farms , to women in remote villages .
#Text=They 're the type who use the mail order method .
#Text=I 've learned this one thing about that sort of woman :

#Text=she may not want that baby , but either before or after it 's born she 'll starve , and save , and go without proper clothing , and even beg , and steal to give it clothes -- clothes with lace on them , with ribbon on them , sheer white things .
#Text=I do n't know why that 's true , but it is .
#Text=Well , we 're not reaching them .
#Text=Our goods are unattractive .
#Text=They 're packed and shipped unattractively .
#Text=Why , all this department needs is a little psychology -- and some lace that does n't look as if it had been chopped out with an ax .
#Text=It 's the little , silly , intimate things that will reach these women .
#Text=No , not silly , either .
#Text=Quite understandable .
#Text=She wants fine things for her baby , just as the silver-spoon mother does .
#Text=The thing we 'll have to do is to give her silver-spoon models at pewter prices . ”
#Text=“ It ca n't be done , ” said Slosson .
#Text=“ Now , wait a minute , Slosson , ”
#Text=Fenger put in , smoothly .
#Text=“ Miss Brandeis has given us a very fair general statement .
#Text=We 'll have some facts .
#Text=Are you prepared to give us an actual working plan ? ”
#Text=“ Yes .
#Text=At least , it sounds practical to me .
#Text=And if it does to you -- and to Mr. Slosson -- ”
#Text=“ Humph ! ” snorted that gentleman , in expression of defiance , unbelief , and a determination not to be impressed .
#Text=It acted as a goad to Fanny .
#Text=She leaned forward in her chair and talked straight at the big , potent force that sat regarding her in silent attention .

#Text=“ I still say that we can copy the high-priced models in low-priced materials because , in almost every case , it is n't the material that makes the expensive model ; it 's the line , the cut , the little trick that gives it style .
#Text=We can get that .
#Text=We 've been giving them stuff that might have been made by prison labor , for all the distinction it had .
#Text=Then I think we ought to make a feature of the sanitary methods used in our infants ' department .
#Text=Every article intended for a baby 's use should be wrapped or boxed as it lies in the bin or on the shelf .
#Text=And those bins ought to be glassed .
#Text=We would advertise that , and it would advertise itself .
#Text=Our visitors would talk about it .
#Text=This department has n't been getting a square deal in the catalogue .
#Text=Not enough space .
#Text=It ought to have not only more catalogue space , but a catalogue all its own -- the Baby Book .
#Text=Full of pictures .
#Text=Good ones .
#Text=Illustrations that will make every mother think her baby will look like that baby , once it is wearing our No. 29E798 -- chubby babies , curly-headed , and dimply .
#Text=And the feature of that catalogue ought to be , not separate garments , but complete outfits .
#Text=Outfits boxed , ready for shipping , and ranging in price all the way from twenty-five dollars to three-ninety-eight -- ”
#Text=“ It ca n't be done ! ” yelled Slosson . “ Three-ninety-eight ! Outfits ! ”
#Text=“ It can be done .
#Text=I 've figured it out , down to a packet of assorted size safety pins .
#Text=We 'll call it our emergency outfit .
#Text=Thirty pieces .
#Text=And while we 're about it , every outfit over five dollars ought to be packed in a pink or a pale blue pasteboard box .
#Text=The outfits trimmed in pink , pink boxes ; the outfits trimmed in blue , blue boxes .
#Text=In eight cases out of ten their letters will tell us whether it 's a pink or blue baby .
#Text=And when they get our package , and take out that pink or blue box , they 'll be as pleased as if we 'd made them a present .
#Text=It 's the personal note -- ”
#Text=“ Personal slop ! ” growled Slosson .
#Text=“ It is n't business .
#Text=It 's sentimental slush ! ”
#Text=“ Sentimental , yes , ” agreed Fanny pleasantly , “ but then , we 're running the only sentimental department in this business .
#Text=And we ought to be doing it at the rate of a million and a quarter a year .
#Text=If you think these last suggestions sentimental , I 'm afraid the next one -- ”
#Text=“ Let 's have it , Miss Brandeis , ”
#Text=Fenger encouraged her quietly .
#Text=“ It's” -- she flashed a mischievous smile at Slosson -- “it 's a mother 's guide and helper , and adviser .
#Text=A woman who 'll answer questions , give advice .
#Text=Some one they 'll write to , with a picture in their minds of a large , comfortable , motherly-looking person in gray .
#Text=You know we get hundreds of letters asking whether they ought to order flannel bands , or the double-knitted kind .
#Text=That sort of thing .
#Text=And who 's been answering them ?
#Text=Some sixteen-year-old girl in the mailing department who does n't know a flannel band from a bootee when she sees it .
#Text=We could call our woman something pleasant and everydayish , like Emily Brand .
#Text=Easy to remember .
#Text=And until we can find her , I 'll answer those letters myself .
#Text=They 're important to us as well as to the woman who writes them .
#Text=And now , there 's the matter of obstetrical outfits .
#Text=Three grades , packed ready for shipment , practical , simple , and complete .
#Text=Our drug section has the separate articles , but we ought to -- ”
#Text=“ Oh , lord ! ” groaned Slosson , and slumped disgustedly in his seat .
